newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: No end in sight in CANTV strike.
newsitem.headline: No end in sight in CANTV strike.

text.p: Talks between Venezuelan telephone company's striking union representatives and management have failed to break an impasse over wage contracts, a union leader said on Wednesday.
"No agreement was reached" at a meeting held on Tuesday at the Labour ministry, Cruz Hernandez, president of the Federation of Telecommunications Workers (Fetratel), told Reuters.
Fetratel represents 29 unions which have been on strike since March 13, a stoppage it says affects one third of CANTV's 17,000 workers. CANTV says the walkout is not affecting operations.
Hernandez stressed that Fetratel "will not go back to the negotiating table until the company accepts our demands."
He said striking CANTV workers planned to stage a march on Wednesday afternoon to Miraflores presidential palace to seek official government mediation in the conflict.
